publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-371 Mr Duncan McNeil: Flooding in Inverclyde—That the Parliament notes that the recent flooding in Inverclyde dealt a blow to the area; recognises that this is a long-term, recurring problem; notes that, were it to persist, it may adversely affect investment in the area, and agrees that a multi-agency approach offers the best opportunity to facilitate a permanent solution.
S1M-371 Flooding in Inverclyde (lodged on 8 December 1999) Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Cathie Craigie*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-371 Mr Duncan McNeil: Flooding in Inverclyde—That the Parliament notes that the recent flooding in Inverclyde dealt a blow to the area; recognises that this is a long-term, recurring problem; notes that, were it to persist, it may adversely affect investment in the area, and agrees that a multi-agency approach offers the best opportunity to facilitate a permanent solution. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie Stone, Cathie Craigie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Dr Richard Simpson*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Allan Wilson*, Trish Godman*
S1M-371# Flooding in Inverclyde (lodged on 8 December 1999) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-371# Mr Duncan McNeil: Flooding in Inverclyde—That the Parliament notes that the recent flooding in Inverclyde dealt a blow to the area; recognises that this is a long-term, recurring problem; notes that, were it to persist, it may adversely affect investment in the area, and agrees that a multi-agency approach offers the best opportunity to facilitate a permanent solution. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie Stone, Cathie Craigie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Michael McMahon, Allan Wilson, Trish Godman, Donald Gorrie
S1M-371# Flooding in Inverclyde (lodged on 8 December 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-371# Flooding in Inverclyde (lodged on 8 December 1999) David Mundell*, Nick Johnston*, Rhoda Grant*, Michael Russell*

S1M-371# Mr Duncan McNeil: Flooding in Inverclyde—That the Parliament notes that the recent flooding in Inverclyde dealt a blow to the area; recognises that this is a long-term, recurring problem; notes that, were it to persist, it may adversely affect investment in the area, and agrees that a multi-agency approach offers the best opportunity to facilitate a permanent solution. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie Stone, Cathie Craigie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Michael McMahon, Allan Wilson, Trish Godman, Donald Gorrie, Ms Margo MacDonald, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Rhoda Grant, Michael Russell, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-371# Flooding in Inverclyde (lodged on 8 December 1999) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Andy Kerr*, Paul Martin*
S1M-371# Flooding in Inverclyde (lodged on 8 December 1999) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-371# Mr Duncan McNeil: Flooding in Inverclyde—That the Parliament notes that the recent flooding in Inverclyde dealt a blow to the area; recognises that this is a long-term, recurring problem; notes that, were it to persist, it may adversely affect investment in the area, and agrees that a multi-agency approach offers the best opportunity to facilitate a permanent solution. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Jamie Stone, Cathie Craigie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Michael McMahon, Allan Wilson, Trish Godman, Donald Gorrie, Ms Margo MacDonald, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Rhoda Grant, Michael Russell, Kay Ullrich, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Andy Kerr, Paul Martin, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill
